Taking Google Analytics Further

Course Overview:

Introductory sentence that will stop visitors in their tracks.

A couple of paragraphs here to draw them in more, making them nod their heads acknowledging their frustration, and then giving them joy that this training will give them confidence and results.

This course will cover:

  • List of inclusions
  • List of inclusions
  • List of inclusions

Course pre-requisites:

A business or personal website or blog with Google Analytics installed, and a minimum of 1 month’s complete data collected.

How to install Google Analytics

To install Google Analytics on your website, follow the steps outlined here.

Installation will vary depending on your website set up. The most important thing to remember is that it must be installed on ALL pages of your website…

Need help installing Google Analytics?

If you need help installing Google Analytics, or want a check that yours is installed correctly, please contact us here.

What’s included:

  • List of inclusions
  • List of inclusions
  • List of inclusions
  • List of inclusions

Who it’s for:

  • Savvy business owners and managers who want to understand what can be tracking on their website, to marry with business goals
  • Webmasters and website managers
  • In-house or independent marketers responsible for driving traffic to and/or activity on websites
  • Web developers who want to understand the activity of visitors on sites they build
  • Anyone who wants to grasp the fundamentals of Google Analytics and understand the basic metrics surrounding the visitation to and activity on your website

Who it’s not for:

People who don’t care about numbers and understanding your historical website data.

About the trainer

The Google Analytics and SEO training courses are facilitated by Erica Stacey (nee Nistico), Top Scout and Digital Marketer at Scout Digital Marketing.

Erica has been working in digital for nearly 10 years, and is obsessed with understanding and using data to improve online results.

She is passionate about helping webmasters understand how to best manage their own website content, optimising it for visitors and search engines, and interpreting their metrics to improve performance.

Google has recognised Erica as a Google Analytics and AdWords certified professional, meaning that she has passed multiple exams that assess her product expertise.

The training venue

All of these half day courses are held in a dedicated computer training room, conveniently located in the Adelaide CBD.

The IVC (International Visualisation Centre)
19 Young Street
Adelaide, South Australia

Car parking

The IVC is surrounded by carparking options. Undercover car parks or public transport are recommended for the half day training courses, as on-street car parks are limited to 1-2 hours).

Food and drinks (i.e. coffee coffee coffee)

A tea and coffee station, water, biscuits and some fruit are provided during the training session.

The IVC is conveniently surrounded by a number of cafes and restaurants for any other food and drinks, before or after the training session.
